comments:
On the menu bar from the main Workbench panel, click File > New > Projects 
Select CVS  >  Checkout projects from CVS  and click next

This fails in a Polish locale, but has no problems in english, or any other
locale we tried.  

Is it possible that a change in the
eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.team.cvs.ui\plugin.properties file for Polish could
cause this error?

Attached is the screenshots showing the panel before selecting "next" and the
error message that is displayed.  You will notice that "CVS" was translated in
Polish to "System CVS", but I don't think that should affect anything.

The error appears to be caused by a failure to load a class (CheckoutWizard). 
I don't see how the locale could affect class loading. It is more likely an 
install issue. How did you install this Eclipse?

We installed the Full SDK on about 6 different machines, all the same way, and
the Polish is the only one having a problem.  We can try to re-install and see
if that fixes it.

I just tried on Windows, and saw the same error message.  It is definitely not
an install issue, as I just changed the locale to Russian and it worked, and
this is on the same machine that it just failed for Polish.

I removed the eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.team.cvs.ui.nl2\plugin_pl.properties
file and the error still occured in the Polish locale.  So that file shouldn't
have anything to do with it.

Pascal, do you have any idea how a change in locale could cause a class 
loading problem.

Is there anything in the log file. Perhaps there is a missing resource that is 
causing problems.

Here's the exception related to the failure:

Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Illegal pattern character 'c'
	at java.text.SimpleDateFormat.compile(SimpleDateFormat.java:700)
	at java.text.SimpleDateFormat.initialize(SimpleDateFormat.java:513)
	at java.text.SimpleDateFormat.<init>(SimpleDateFormat.java:462)
	at java.text.SimpleDateFormat.<init>(SimpleDateFormat.java:443)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.console.CVSOutputConsole.<clinit>
(CVSOutputConsole.java:60)

The date format is taken from the message.properties. Here's what is in the 
English bundle:

Console.resultTimeFormat='(took 'm:ss.SSS')'

So, there are two problems. One is that the code fails if the entry is 
invalid. I will fix this so it doesn't fail. The second is that the Polich 
local has an invalid time format.

It appears the english and polish are as follows...

english:
Console.resultTimeFormat='(took 'm:ss.SSS')'

Polish
Console.resultTimeFormat=(czas: 'm:ss.SSS')


So is the missing single quotes in the Polish property key causing the problem?

It works in the polish locale now.

You can close this if you like, or leave open in regards to your "the code fails
if the entry is invalid. I will fix this so it doesn't fail." comment.

Thank you
I have released the CVS fix to HEAD
